Package mmj.lang

Class WorkVarManager

java.lang.Object
mmj.lang.WorkVarManager
public class WorkVarManager extends Object
WorkVarManager is a "helper" class that is used to define, declare, alloc and maintain state information about a set of Work Variables.

  • Constructor Details

    • WorkVarManager

      public WorkVarManager(Grammar grammar)
      Sole constructor for WorkVarManager.

      Does nothing except allocate the Arraylists to hold input definitions. Note therefore that the WorkVarManager object is not ready for use by ProofAsst or elsewhere until the Work Variables are actually declared, and a NullPointerException will result if access is attempted before then.

      Parameters:
      grammar - Grammar object for loaded .mm file.

  • Method Details

    • areWorkVarsDeclared

      public boolean areWorkVarsDeclared()
      Returns true if the Work Variables have been declared.

      If no Work Variable definitions are input and the Proof Assistant is instantiated prior to declaration of Work Variables, ProofAsstBoss.java will declare the Work Variables using the default definitions. Which is why we need this function...

      Returns:
      true if Work Variables declared yet.

    • defineWorkVarType

      public void defineWorkVarType(Grammar grammar, String grammaticalTypCdIn, String workVarPrefixIn, int nbrWorkVarsIn) throws VerifyException
      Define the Work Variables to be used for a given grammatical type code.

      The definitions are stored separately from the tables constructed by "Declare". This allows mixing of definitions and default values for Work Variables.

      Parameters:
      grammar - Grammar object for loaded .mm file.
      grammaticalTypCdIn - String holding the Cnst used as a Type Code (e.g. "wff").
      workVarPrefixIn - String holding the prefix to be used with a numeric suffix to name Work Variables of a given Type.
      nbrWorkVarsIn - number of Work Variables to declare for this Type Code.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if individual field values are invalid.

    • declareWorkVars

      public void declareWorkVars(Grammar grammar, LogicalSystem logicalSystem) throws VerifyException
      Declare the Work Variables that have been defined.

      The input definitions and default values for each grammatical Type Code are used to create the Work Variable objects and finalize the WorkVarManager object for actual use.

      Note that final validation checks are performed to ensure that there are no duplicate Var or VarHyp names, either among the Work Variable objects or the other symbols and statements defined in the LogicalSystem for the input .mm file. This means checking for duplicate Work Var prefixes as well as checking each WorkVar and WorkVarHyp name against the LogicalSystem's Symbol and Statement tables.

      Parameters:
      grammar - Grammar object for loaded .mm file.
      logicalSystem - LogicalSystem for loaded .mm file.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if duplicate Var or VarHyp names result or if there is a conflict with the Symbol and Statement table namespaces.

    • editGrammaticalTypCd

      public Cnst editGrammaticalTypCd(Grammar grammar, String grammaticalTypCdIn) throws VerifyException
      Validates an input string as being a valid Type Code for Work Variables.
      Parameters:
      grammar - Grammar object for loaded .mm file.
      grammaticalTypCdIn - String Type Code (Cnst)
      Returns:
      Cnst Type Code.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if input Type Code invalid.

    • editWorkVarPrefix

      public String editWorkVarPrefix(String workVarPrefixIn) throws VerifyException
      Validates an input string as being a valid WorkVar Prefix.

      Duplicate checking is not done here, just checking to make sure that the input prefix characters are valid Metamath "math symbols".

      Parameters:
      workVarPrefixIn - String of Metamath math symbols.
      Returns:
      workVarPrefix string, trimmed.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if workVarPrefixIn has non math symbols or is null or empty.

    • editNbrWorkVars

      public Integer editNbrWorkVars(int nbrWorkVarsIn) throws VerifyException
      Validates an input string specifying the number of WorkVar objects to be declared for a specific Type Code.

      Basically this is just a range check: greater than some number (9) and less than some other number (999).

      Parameters:
      nbrWorkVarsIn - Number of WorkVar objects for a given Type Code.
      Returns:
      nbrWorkVars input int converted to Integer (for storage in ArrayList).
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if nbrWorkVarsIn out of range.

    • isAllocated

      public boolean isAllocated(WorkVar workVar)
      Returns true if input Work Var is allocated.

      Note: this is a weird function, since how could an unallocated WorkVar be input to see whether or not it is allocates? BUT... consult StepUnifier.finalizeAndLoadAssrtSubst() for explanatory remarks...

      Parameters:
      workVar - the Work Var to check
      Returns:
      true if input Work Var is allocated.

    • resolveWorkVarUpdates

      public void resolveWorkVarUpdates()
      Deallocates Work Vars that have updates and eliminates chains of WorkVar updates so that a Work Var update subtree contains only non-updated Work Vars.

      Processing is by Type Code, in reverse order by Work Var number within Type Code so that subsequent alloc() calls begin with the lowest deallocated Work Var numbers.

      Example: WorkVar "A" where = B and B = C results in update clone of A.paSubst: A = C.

    • alloc

      public WorkVar alloc(String workVarIn)
      Allocates the WorkVar specified by the input token if necessary assuming it is a valid WorkVar token string.

      If the WorkVar is already allocated it just returns the WorkVar instance.

      The input String must consist of a prefix which matches one of the specified WorkVar prefixes, followed by a positive integer within the range of WorkVar numbers specified for the Type Code corresponding to the prefix.

      Parameters:
      workVarIn - token specifying a WorkVar (id)
      Returns:
      allocated WorkVar or null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if workVarIn is null or an empty String.

    • alloc

      public WorkVar alloc(WorkVar workVar)
      Allocates a given WorkVar.

      It is hard to envision using this function...

      Parameters:
      workVar - to be allocated.
      Returns:
      allocated WorkVar.

    • allocWorkVarHyp

      public WorkVarHyp allocWorkVarHyp(Cnst typ) throws VerifyException
      Allocates a new WorkVar for the input Type Code and returns the corresponding WorkVarHyp.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      allocated WorkVar's WorkVarHyp.
      Throws:
      VerifyException - if no remaining WorkVar objects are available for use with the given Type Code.

    • setPrevAllocNbr

      public void setPrevAllocNbr(Cnst typ, int prevAllocNbr)
      Sets the value of prevAllocIndex for a Type Code.

      In other words, if we input '1' for &W1, then the next allocation will be &W2.

      If the input prevAllocNbr is invalid a default setting of zero is used instead.

      Parameters:
      typ - Cnst Type Code of prevAllocIndex to set.
      prevAllocNbr - is one greater than prevAllocIndex
